TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SdcaStatic extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Extension methods and utilities for instantiating SDCA trainer estimators inside statically typed pipelines.

MemberSignature.Value: public static ValueTuple<Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<float>,Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<float>,Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool>> Sdca (this Microsoft.ML.BinaryClassificationContext.BinaryClassificationTrainers ctx, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool> label, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<float> features, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<float> weights = null, Nullable<float> l2Const = null, Nullable<float> l1Threshold = null, Nullable<int> maxIterations = null, Action<Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Learners.LinearBinaryPredictor,Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.Calibration.ParameterMixingCalibratedPredictor> onFit = null);

static member Sdca : Microsoft.ML.BinaryClassificationContext.BinaryClassificationTrainers * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool> * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<single> * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<single> * Nullable<single> * Nullable<single> * Nullable<int> * Action<Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Learners.LinearBinaryPredictor, Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Internal.Calibration.ParameterMixingCalibratedPredictor> -> ValueTuple<Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<single>, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<single>, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool>>
MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.Trainers.SdcaStatic.Sdca (ctx, label, features, weights, l2Const, l1Threshold, maxIterations, onFit)

Docs.param: The binary classification context trainer object.
The L1 regularization hyperparameter. Higher values will tend to lead to more sparse model.
The maximum number of passes to perform over the data.

A delegate that is called every time the method is called on the instance created out of this. This delegate will receive the linear model that was trained, as well as the calibrator on top of that model. Note that this action cannot change the result in any way; it is only a way for the caller to be informed about what was learnt.
Docs.summary: Predict a target using a linear binary classification model trained with the SDCA trainer, and log-loss.
Docs.returns: The set of output columns including in order the predicted binary classification score (which will range from negative to positive infinity), the calibrated prediction (from 0 to 1), and the predicted label.

static member Sdca : Microsoft.ML.BinaryClassificationContext.BinaryClassificationTrainers * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool> * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<single> * Microsoft.ML.Runtime.ISupportSdcaClassificationLoss * Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<single> * Nullable<single> * Nullable<single> * Nullable<int> * Action<Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Learners.LinearBinaryPredictor> -> ValueTuple<Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<single>, Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Scalar<bool>>
MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.Trainers.SdcaStatic.Sdca (ctx, label, features, loss, weights, l2Const, l1Threshold, maxIterations, onFit)

Docs.param: The binary classification context trainer object.
The L1 regularization hyperparameter. Higher values will tend to lead to more sparse model.
The maximum number of passes to perform over the data.

A delegate that is called every time the method is called on the instance created out of this. This delegate will receive the linear model that was trained, as well as the calibrator on top of that model. Note that this action cannot change the result in any way; it is only a way for the caller to be informed about what was learnt.
Docs.summary: Predict a target using a linear binary classification model trained with the SDCA trainer, and a custom loss. Note that because we cannot be sure that all loss functions will produce naturally calibrated outputs, setting a custom loss function will not produce a calibrated probability column.
Docs.returns: The set of output columns including in order the predicted binary classification score (which will range from negative to positive infinity), and the predicted label.

Docs.param: The L1 regularization hyperparameter. Higher values will tend to lead to more sparse model.
The maximum number of passes to perform over the data.
The custom loss, if unspecified will be .

A delegate that is called every time the method is called on the instance created out of this. This delegate will receive the linear model that was trained. Note that this action cannot change the result in any way; it is only a way for the caller to be informed about what was learnt.
Docs.summary: Predict a target using a linear regression model trained with the SDCA trainer.

MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.ML.Trainers.SdcaStatic.Sdca (ctx, label, features, loss, weights, l2Const, l1Threshold, maxIterations, onFit)

Docs.param: The multiclass classification context trainer object.
The L1 regularization hyperparameter. Higher values will tend to lead to more sparse model.
The maximum number of passes to perform over the data.

A delegate that is called every time the method is called on the instance created out of this. This delegate will receive the linear model that was trained. Note that this action cannot change the result in any way; it is only a way for the caller to be informed about what was learnt.
Docs.summary: Predict a target using a linear multiclass classification model trained with the SDCA trainer.
Docs.returns: The set of output columns including in order the predicted per-class likelihoods (between 0 and 1, and summing up to 1), and the predicted label.
